examples.translation: What did you learn in school today?

glosses: to come to know, to find out, discover

examples.translation: My mother should not find out that I have been here.

etymology:
Inherited from Ottoman Turkish اوكرنمك (öğrenmek, “to learn”), from Old Anatolian Turkish اوكرنمك (ögrenmek, “to learn”), from Proto-Turkic *ögren-. See also öğretmek (“to teach”), causative form of the same root.
Cognates
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (ögrenmēk, “to learn”), Azerbaijani öyrənmək (“to learn”), Bashkir өйрәнеү (öyrənew, “to learn”), Chagatai [script needed] (örgenmek, “to learn”), Chuvash вӗрен (vĕren, “to learn”), Kazakh үйрену (üirenu, “to learn”), Khakas ӱгренерге (ügrenerge, “to learn”), Kipchak [script needed] (ȫren-/öwren-, “to learn”), Kumyk уьйренмек (üyrenmek), Kyrgyz үйрөнүү (üyrönüü, “to learn”), Northern Altai ӱгренерге (ügrenerge), Salar örğen, Southern Altai ӱренер (ürener), Tatar өйрәнү (öyränü, “to learn”), Tuvan өөренир (öörenir, “to learn”), Turkmen öwrenmek (“to learn”), Uyghur ئۆگەنمەك (ögenmek, “to learn”), Uzbek oʻrganmoq (“to learn”), Yakut үөрэн (üören, “to learn”).
